alert.note: Alert for Brown; Cherry; Keya Paha (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 12 at 5:17PM CDT until October 13 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM CDT /1015 PM MDT/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Nebraska, including the following counties, Brown, Cherry and Keya Paha. * WHEN...Until 1115 PM CDT /1015 PM MDT/ Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 514 PM CDT /414 PM MDT/, Local law enforcement reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ainsworth, Johnstown, Antelope Peak, Bobcat State Wildlife Management Area, North River Trail, Meadville and Keller Park State Recreation Area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
